intro: Acer tetramerum var. haopingense, commonly known as the Haoping maple, is a rare and endemic species native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the Sapindaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive palmate leaves with five to seven lobes. The tree typically grows in mountainous areas with cool, moist climates, preferring well-drained soils. Its ornamental value lies in its vibrant autumn foliage, which displays shades of red and orange. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
